quote_a: I always have a solution. I haven't had a situation where I needed it excessively. I always manage to do as before and find an alternative solution to meet my needs.
explanation: The repeated insistence on always managing without AI and never needing it reads as performative self-sufficiency — convincing themselves rather than simply describing their behaviour.

quote_a: I know it could save me time, but again, for the reasons I mentioned, I prefer not to do it.
quote_b: I always have a solution. I haven't had a situation where I needed it excessively. I always manage to do as before and find an alternative solution to meet my needs.
explanation: In one breath the participant acknowledges AI would save them time, and in another claims they have never had a situation where they needed it excessively — these sentiments sit in mild tension.
